project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Economic Governance Technical Assistance Grant (EGTAG) is to assist the Government in strengthening its institutional capacity in the areas of budgetary planning and execution, investment and project planning, control, procurement, transparency, participatory monitoring, and reform constituency building. The project has the following four components: Component 1) aims at development of capacity to produce and execute a budget, track its implementation, and reduce irregular uses and expenditures. Component 2) EGTAG will support the Human Resource Unit in the Prime Minister's Office to focus strengthening of human resource program, civil service reform, and further development of training capacity. Component 3) The United States Agency for International Development and Inter-American Development Bank anticorruption projects will fund some Anti-corruption Unit activities directly. Component 4) the program supported by the EGTAG will be implemented under the project management mechanism developed for the Low-income Countries under Stress (LICUS) Trust Fund grant, and will have an overall coordinator as well as an individual responsible for the area of budget reform.
